title: Whitney Houston nominated for Rock and Roll Hall Of Fame
text:
Whitney has been nominated for the class of 2020 (Picture: Getty Images)

Whitney Houston has been nominated for a place in the Rock and Roll Hall Of Fame.

The star, who tragically died back in 2012, was never nominated during her lifetime, despite being one of the most renowned singers across the globe.

However, since a nomination doesn’t necessarily equate to a place in the Hall Of Fame, fans will have a while to wait until anything is confirmed, with the decision being made in 2020.

Artists are eligible to be inducted 25 years after the release of their first album, with Whitney’s debut record being released in 1985.

She tragically died back in 2012 (Picture: Redferns)

The I Will Always Love You singer will be up against musicians including Judas Priest, Motörhead, Nine Inch Nails, and Thin Lizzy – so safe to say it’s a pretty varied bunch.

The decision will be made by more than 1000 musicians, experts and critics, with fans able to vote for their favourites online.

The Beatles, Bob Dylan, Michael Jackson, and Janis Joplin are just a few of the stars who have already made the cut, with recent inductee Robert Smith’s post-induction interview going viral after he completely shut down an overexcited reporter.

And the nomination isn’t the only way the star is being remembered this year, after it was reported that a hologram tour honouring the diva will be launching in the UK next year.

The New York Times also claimed that the late star’s original band and backup singers would support the hologram on stage.

She’ll be joining fellow music legends like Janis Joplin and The Beatles (Picture: Getty Images)

Talking about the news, Whitney’s sister Pat told the publication: ‘The hologram has taken precedence over everything.’

She continued: ‘Before she passed, there was so much negativity around the name; it wasn’t about the music anymore.

‘People had forgotten how great she was. They let all the personal things about her life outweigh why they fell in love with her in the first place.’

Whitney passed away in 2012 after accidentally drowning in her hotel bathtub at the age of 48.
